dom-securitypolicyviolationevent-securit.name: SecurityPolicyViolationEvent
dom-securitypolicyviolationevent-securit.summary: The SecurityPolicyViolationEvent constructor creates a new SecurityPolicyViolationEvent object instance.
dom-securitypolicyviolationevent-securit.title: SecurityPolicyViolationEvent.SecurityPolicyViolationEvent()

dom-securitypolicyviolationevent-blocked.name: blockedURI
dom-securitypolicyviolationevent-blocked.summary: The blockedURI read-only property of the SecurityPolicyViolationEvent interface is a USVString representing the URI of the resource that was blocked because it violates a policy.
dom-securitypolicyviolationevent-blocked.title: SecurityPolicyViolationEvent.blockedURI

dom-securitypolicyviolationevent-columnn.name: columnNumber
dom-securitypolicyviolationevent-columnn.summary: The columnNumber read-only property of the SecurityPolicyViolationEvent interface is the column number in the document or worker at which the violation occurred.
dom-securitypolicyviolationevent-columnn.title: SecurityPolicyViolationEvent.columnNumber

dom-securitypolicyviolationevent-disposi.name: disposition
dom-securitypolicyviolationevent-disposi.summary: The disposition read-only property of the SecurityPolicyViolationEvent interface indicates how the violated policy is configured to be treated by the user agent.
dom-securitypolicyviolationevent-disposi.title: SecurityPolicyViolationEvent.disposition

dom-securitypolicyviolationevent-documen.name: documentURI
dom-securitypolicyviolationevent-documen.summary: The documentURI read-only property of the SecurityPolicyViolationEvent interface is a USVString representing the URI of the document or worker in which the violation was found.
dom-securitypolicyviolationevent-documen.title: SecurityPolicyViolationEvent.documentURI

dom-securitypolicyviolationevent-effecti.name: effectiveDirective
dom-securitypolicyviolationevent-effecti.summary: The effectiveDirective read-only property of the SecurityPolicyViolationEvent interface is a DOMString representing the directive whose enforcement uncovered the violation.
dom-securitypolicyviolationevent-effecti.title: SecurityPolicyViolationEvent.effectiveDirective

dom-securitypolicyviolationevent-linenum.name: lineNumber
dom-securitypolicyviolationevent-linenum.summary: The lineNumber read-only property of the SecurityPolicyViolationEvent interface is the line number in the document or worker at which the violation occurred.
dom-securitypolicyviolationevent-linenum.title: SecurityPolicyViolationEvent.lineNumber

dom-securitypolicyviolationevent-origina.name: originalPolicy
dom-securitypolicyviolationevent-origina.summary: The originalPolicy read-only property of the SecurityPolicyViolationEvent interface is a DOMString containing the policy whose enforcement uncovered the violation.
dom-securitypolicyviolationevent-origina.title: SecurityPolicyViolationEvent.originalPolicy

dom-securitypolicyviolationevent-referre.name: referrer
dom-securitypolicyviolationevent-referre.summary: The referrer read-only property of the SecurityPolicyViolationEvent interface is a USVString representing the referrer of the resources whose policy was violated. This will be a URL or null.
dom-securitypolicyviolationevent-referre.title: SecurityPolicyViolationEvent.referrer

dom-securitypolicyviolationevent-sample.name: sample
dom-securitypolicyviolationevent-sample.summary: The sample read-only property of the SecurityPolicyViolationEvent interface is a DOMString representing a sample of the resource that caused the violation.
dom-securitypolicyviolationevent-sample.title: SecurityPolicyViolationEvent.sample

dom-securitypolicyviolationevent-sourcef.name: sourceFile
dom-securitypolicyviolationevent-sourcef.summary: The sourceFile read-only property of the SecurityPolicyViolationEvent interface is a USVString representing the URI of the document or worker in which the violation was found.
dom-securitypolicyviolationevent-sourcef.title: SecurityPolicyViolationEvent.sourceFile

dom-securitypolicyviolationevent-statusc.name: statusCode
dom-securitypolicyviolationevent-statusc.summary: The statusCode read-only property of the SecurityPolicyViolationEvent interface is a number representing the HTTP status code of the document or worker in which the violation occurred.
dom-securitypolicyviolationevent-statusc.title: SecurityPolicyViolationEvent.statusCode

dom-securitypolicyviolationevent-violate.name: violatedDirective
dom-securitypolicyviolationevent-violate.summary: The violatedDirective read-only property of the SecurityPolicyViolationEvent interface is a DOMString representing the directive whose enforcement uncovered the violation.
dom-securitypolicyviolationevent-violate.title: SecurityPolicyViolationEvent.violatedDirective

report-violation.name: SecurityPolicyViolationEvent
report-violation.summary: The SecurityPolicyViolationEvent interface inherits from Event, and represents the event object of an event sent on a document or worker when its content security policy is violated.
report-violation.title: SecurityPolicyViolationEvent

directive-base-uri.name: base-uri
directive-base-uri.summary: The HTTP Content-Security-Policy base-uri directive restricts the URLs which can be used in a document's <base> element. If this value is absent, then any URI is allowed. If this directive is absent, the user agent will use the value in the <base> element.
directive-base-uri.title: CSP: base-uri

directive-child-src.name: child-src
directive-child-src.summary: The HTTP Content-Security-Policy (CSP) child-src directive defines the valid sources for web workers and nested browsing contexts loaded using elements such as <frame> and <iframe>. For workers, non-compliant requests are treated as fatal network errors by the user agent.
directive-child-src.title: CSP: child-src

directive-connect-src.name: connect-src
directive-connect-src.summary: The HTTP Content-Security-Policy (CSP) connect-src directive restricts the URLs which can be loaded using script interfaces. The APIs that are restricted are:

firefox.notes: Prior to Firefox 50, ping attributes of <a> elements weren't covered by connect-src.

directive-connect-src.title: CSP: connect-src

directive-default-src.name: default-src
directive-default-src.summary: The HTTP Content-Security-Policy (CSP) default-src directive serves as a fallback for the other CSP fetch directives.
directive-default-src.title: CSP: default-src

directive-font-src.name: font-src
directive-font-src.summary: The HTTP Content-Security-Policy (CSP) font-src directive specifies valid sources for fonts loaded using @font-face.
directive-font-src.title: CSP: font-src

directive-form-action.name: form-action
directive-form-action.summary: The HTTP Content-Security-Policy (CSP) form-action directive restricts the URLs which can be used as the target of a form submissions from a given context.
directive-form-action.title: CSP: form-action

directive-frame-ancestors.name: frame-ancestors
directive-frame-ancestors.summary: The HTTP Content-Security-Policy (CSP) frame-ancestors directive specifies valid parents that may embed a page using <frame>, <iframe>, <object>, <embed>, or <applet>.

firefox_android.notes: Before Firefox for Android 58, frame-ancestors is ignored in Content-Security-Policy-Report-Only.

directive-frame-ancestors.title: CSP: frame-ancestors

directive-frame-src.name: frame-src
directive-frame-src.summary: The HTTP Content-Security-Policy (CSP) frame-src directive specifies valid sources for nested browsing contexts loading using elements such as <frame> and <iframe>.
directive-frame-src.title: CSP: frame-src

directive-img-src.name: img-src
directive-img-src.summary: The HTTP Content-Security-Policy img-src directive specifies valid sources of images and favicons.
directive-img-src.title: CSP: img-src

directive-manifest-src.name: manifest-src
directive-manifest-src.summary: The HTTP Content-Security-Policy: manifest-src directive specifies which manifest can be applied to the resource.
directive-manifest-src.title: CSP: manifest-src

directive-media-src.name: media-src
directive-media-src.summary: The HTTP Content-Security-Policy (CSP) media-src directive specifies valid sources for loading media using the <audio> and <video> elements.
directive-media-src.title: CSP: media-src

directive-navigate-to.name: navigate-to
directive-navigate-to.summary: The HTTP Content-Security-Policy (CSP) navigate-to directive restricts the URLs to which a document can initiate navigations by any means including <form> (if form-action is not specified), <a>, window.location, window.open, etc. This is an enforcement on what navigations this document initiates not on what this document is allowed to navigate to.
directive-navigate-to.title: CSP: navigate-to

directive-object-src.name: object-src
directive-object-src.summary: The HTTP Content-Security-Policy object-src directive specifies valid sources for the <object>, <embed>, and <applet> elements.
directive-object-src.title: CSP: object-src

directive-plugin-types.name: plugin-types
directive-plugin-types.summary: The HTTP Content-Security-Policy (CSP) plugin-types directive restricts the set of plugins that can be embedded into a document by limiting the types of resources which can be loaded.
directive-plugin-types.title: CSP: plugin-types

prefetch-src.name: prefetch-src
prefetch-src.summary: The HTTP Content-Security-Policy (CSP) prefetch-src directive specifies valid resources that may be prefetched or prerendered.
prefetch-src.title: CSP: prefetch-src

directive-sandbox.name: sandbox
directive-sandbox.summary: The HTTP Content-Security-Policy (CSP) sandbox directive enables a sandbox for the requested resource similar to the <iframe> sandbox attribute. It applies restrictions to a page's actions including preventing popups, preventing the execution of plugins and scripts, and enforcing a same-origin policy.
directive-sandbox.title: CSP: sandbox

directive-script-src.name: script-src
directive-script-src.summary: The HTTP Content-Security-Policy (CSP) script-src directive specifies valid sources for JavaScript. This includes not only URLs loaded directly into <script> elements, but also things like inline script event handlers (onclick) and XSLT stylesheets which can trigger script execution.
directive-script-src.title: CSP: script-src

directive-script-src-attr.name: script-src-attr
directive-script-src-attr.summary: The HTTP Content-Security-Policy (CSP) script-src-attr directive specifies valid sources for JavaScript inline event handlers. This includes only inline script event handlers like onclick, but not URLs loaded directly into <script> elements.
directive-script-src-attr.title: CSP: script-src-attr

directive-script-src-elem.name: script-src-elem
directive-script-src-elem.summary: The HTTP Content-Security-Policy (CSP) script-src-elem directive specifies valid sources for JavaScript <script> elements, but not inline script event handlers like onclick.
directive-script-src-elem.title: CSP: script-src-elem

directive-style-src.name: style-src
directive-style-src.summary: The HTTP Content-Security-Policy (CSP) style-src directive specifies valid sources for stylesheets.
directive-style-src.title: CSP: style-src

directive-style-src-attr.name: style-src-attr
directive-style-src-attr.summary: The HTTP Content-Security-Policy (CSP) style-src-attr directive specifies valid sources for inline styles applied to individual DOM elements.
directive-style-src-attr.title: CSP: style-src-attr

directive-style-src-elem.name: style-src-elem
directive-style-src-elem.summary: The HTTP Content-Security-Policy (CSP) style-src-elem directive specifies valid sources for stylesheets <style> elements and <link> elements with rel="stylesheet".
directive-style-src-elem.title: CSP: style-src-elem

directive-worker-src.name: worker-src
directive-worker-src.summary: The HTTP Content-Security-Policy (CSP) worker-src directive specifies valid sources for Worker, SharedWorker, or ServiceWorker scripts.

chrome.notes: Chrome 59 and higher skips the deprecated child-src directive.

chrome_android.notes: Chrome 59 and higher skips the deprecated child-src directive.

webview_android.notes: Chrome 59 and higher skips the deprecated child-src directive.

edge_blink.notes: Chrome 59 and higher skips the deprecated child-src directive.

directive-worker-src.title: CSP: worker-src
